medical_history.chief_complaint: Burning sensation in the left upper quadrant of abdomen radiating to the left flank.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 4 hours prior to presentation. The patient reported severe pain associated with nausea and nonbloody vomiting. He had improvement of pain after an earlier visit but experienced persistent pain, which he described as similar to prior nephrolithiasis. The pain worsens with deep breaths.
medical_history.social_history: Does not smoke or drink significant amounts of alcohol.
